output: Print out the amount of possible possibilities for Dabriel's game. Since this amount can be very large, print only the rest of the division of that quantity by 109+7.
input: The first line of the test case contains two integers N and M (1 ≤ N, M ≤ 100), representing the number of rows and columns of the matrix, respectively. The next N lines contain M characters, being: '.', '1', '0', where '.' represents a cell that has not yet received a binary value.
name: Binarizing the Matrix
